newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX spot heat bucks declines on short covering.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX spot heat bucks declines on short covering.

text.p: NYMEX prompt heating oil remained firm Monday afternoon on short covering, bucking declines in the oil prices which fell for the fifth session.
"You ahd a lot traders who were short the heat crack who are now covering, so crude is being sold for heating oil," said a New York crude trader.
At 1422 EST, March heating oil was up 0.02 cent a gallon at 60.55 cents a gallon. The March gasoline-to-crude rose to $3.53 a barrel from $3.19 on Friday.
"Buying in the March and selling April seems to be the feature of the day," said a New York heating oil dealer.
"Buying in the March and selling April seems to be the feature of the day," said a New York heating oil dealer, noting there was short covering in outright heat as well.
Crude and gasoline continued to be buffeted by fund selling, with March open interest declining sharply in crude.

March crude was off one cent a barrel at $22.22 after falling to $21.62 earlier in the session. Strength in heating oil was supportive to crude, dealers said. March gasoline was off 0.26 cent at 62.80 cents a gallon.

A seasonal downturn in oil prices amid weak refined product demand have sent prices into a tailspin since early last week. March crude has lost close to $2.00 a barrel, March heating oil has lost about five cents a gallon and gasoline has lost more than five cents a gallon since last Monday.
There has been some talk that the March/April crude spread could slip into contango, but most dealers said the year-over-year crude inventory deficit would keep prices backwardated.
The American Petroleum Institute (API) said crude stocks were 9.6 million barrels below a year ago as of January 31.
The March/April crude spread expanded to 22 cents from 16 cents on Friday.
-- Harry Milling, New York Energy Desk, 212-859-1761
